channel.title: New school new problems
channel.description:
I am posting this thread to get some help/recommendations for my new school.
All since kindergarten to 7th grade I have been the cool guy that is good at sports/fun to hang with. All until last year. Last year I went to a brand new school and ran into total @#!*% bags. Since I've never encountered one of these idiots before, I never really stood up for myself and take physical action. Longstory short somebody got a picture of me that was suppose to be a joke but everyone took it seriously and I was labeled as the gay kid.
I REALLY don't want anything like this to happen again, because I am attending a new school once again. Any suggestions?

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:75, topic:410587”][quote author=Frell link=topic=511867.msg3716609#msg3716609 date=1313682153]
It doesnt matter, your argument is void. Strength isn’t measured in reps, its measured in weight. So basically, if you can lift it you can lift it.
[/quote]

I believe that is debatable.[/quote]
Muscle size plays a role, so its pretty much the same throughout everyone, thats why workout routines don’t have height chart.

Read full topic

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

I got in a fight with someone much bigger than me, muscle doesn’t really matter if you know Taekwondo :D.

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Frell:

But your muscles are smaller…

Not necessarily. Bigger people can put on more muscle because they have a bigger frame. If a smaller person has the same amount of muscle as I do, they would be able to bench more because they don’t have to do as much work.

Read full topic

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

But your muscles are smaller…

Read full topic

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I don’t think you understand. If you have shorter arms, you don’t have to push as far making you less tired and more able to do more reps.

Read full topic

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:67, topic:410587”][quote author=Frell link=topic=511867.msg3715971#msg3715971 date=1313631633]

Shorter people bench more. Shorter arms - smaller distance to push.

Thats like saying fat people can do more push ups because they have weight to help them go down. It doesnt matter how far you push it, if you can lift it you can lift it.
[/quote]

That’s different. My arms are about maybe 2 and a half feet in length. (rough guess). My friend that I work out with has 2-3 inches shorter arms. If I were to go down and up the same length as him, I can do 155 repping. But I don’t, I go all the way down and hit my chest, and therefore I can only rep about 135. If I stopped 2-3 inches above my chest, it makes things hella easier.[/quote]
But humans are proportionate, if you can lift it/push it then you can do just that. It has nothing to do with reps.

Read full topic

Thats like saying fat people can do more push ups because they have weight to help them go down. It doesnt matter how far you push it, if you can lift it you can lift it.

That’s different. My arms are about maybe 2 and a half feet in length. (rough guess). My friend that I work out with has 2-3 inches shorter arms. If I were to go down and up the same length as him, I can do 155 repping. But I don’t, I go all the way down and hit my chest, and therefore I can only rep about 135. If I stopped 2-3 inches above my chest, it makes things hella easier.[/quote]

lulz arnold was like 6foot4 and benching 500+ show me a midget that can compete with that. logic is flawed.

Thats like saying fat people can do more push ups because they have weight to help them go down. It doesnt matter how far you push it, if you can lift it you can lift it.[/quote]

That’s different. My arms are about maybe 2 and a half feet in length. (rough guess). My friend that I work out with has 2-3 inches shorter arms. If I were to go down and up the same length as him, I can do 155 repping. But I don’t, I go all the way down and hit my chest, and therefore I can only rep about 135. If I stopped 2-3 inches above my chest, it makes things hella easier.

item.title: New school new problems

item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Use ur sprinting power and run out of every situation. That’s what I do.

item.title: New school new problems
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

What others are saying, stop giving a shit what people think of you. All through high school I was myself, weird and uncensored. I wore pajama pants and sandals to school, and had tons of people talk to me every day. Be fake and you’ll get nowhere.

“Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don’t matter and those who matter don’t mind.” - Dr. Seuss

Read full topic

[quote=“Frell, post:58, topic:410587”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=511867.msg3715824#msg3715824 date=1313626157]

Well actually I think im 5’4, and no, midgets are 4’8 or under by the age of 18 lol

www.dictionary.com

Definition of midget | Dictionary.com

Definition of midget from Dictionary.com, the world’s leading online source for English definitions, pronunciations, word origins, idioms, Word of the Day, and more.

legally it’s 4’8. midget is just a general term referring to short though.
[/quote]
You know what I say to people who call me a midget?

Im not a midget. I dont waddle.

penguin+waddle.jpg800×600
[/quote]
since when do midgets waddle wat
